title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian markets saw choppy movement on Wednesday. Nifty closed lower by 41 points. Analysts suggest the underlying trend remains weak. Nifty is expected to find support around 25700-25650 levels. Any bounce back may face resistance around 25950-26000 levels. Foreign portfolio investors were net sellers.

title: Stocks in news: Ola Electric, Vedanta, Akzo Nobel, Jio Financial, NTPC
summary: Markets experienced volatility, closing with a marginal decline amid ongoing currency swings and mixed global signals. Analysts anticipate continued choppy price action, with key support at 25,700 and resistance around 25,950–26,050. Several companies, including Ola Electric, Vedanta, and NTPC, are in focus due to significant news developments.

title: More drops for AI stocks drag Wall Street to its worst day in nearly a month
summary: U.S. stock markets experienced a downturn for the fourth consecutive day, primarily driven by declines in AI stocks. The S&P 500 saw its worst day in nearly a month, with companies like Broadcom, Oracle, and Nvidia facing significant drops. Concerns about AI investment profitability and rising corporate debt weighed on investor sentiment.

title: Asian stocks decline as traders retreat from tech
summary: Asian markets opened lower mirroring losses in the US. Global investors adopted a risk-off approach. Technology stocks faced significant selling pressure. This sentiment impacted cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. However, US futures showed a slight uptick. Concerns over AI company valuations and infrastructure spending are growing. This led to a rise in Treasury yields for longer maturities. Gold and silver prices surged.

title: Shriram Finance board to weigh stake sale to MUFG
summary: Shriram Finance's board will meet to consider selling an equity stake to Japan's MUFG, potentially for over ₹40,000 crore. This would be the largest strategic investment by an overseas lender in an Indian NBFC, following SMBC's investment in Yes Bank. The deal involves a primary issuance, with MUFG open to a higher stake later.

title: Insurers may soon get direct equity access to unlisted cos
summary: A proposed bill could allow Indian insurers, managing over ₹70 lakh crore, to invest directly in unlisted companies, removing a long-standing legal bar. This move would align them with other state-backed institutions and unlock new long-term capital for infrastructure and entrepreneurial ventures by enabling direct equity investments in private limited companies.

title: Can new acquisitions and capex drive Samvardhana stock to new highs?
summary: Samvardhana Motherson International's shares surged to a 52-week high, driven by anticipated revenue growth and margin expansion. The auto ancillary firm is investing heavily in new facilities and acquisitions, bolstering its order book and positioning for long-term industry consolidation and EV transition benefits.

title: Margin trading book at record high in Nov, but growth rate dips
summary: Investor borrowing via Margin Trading Funding reached a record high in November. However, the growth rate decelerated compared to previous months. This slowdown is linked to the weak performance of mid- and small-cap stocks. The overall equity market turnover on NSE also saw a decline. Analysts suggest this trend may continue until key market indices show sustained upward movement.

title: Sebi tweaks MF, IPO rules, skips conflict of interest changes
summary: The capital market regulator has approved significant changes to mutual fund fee structures, aiming for greater transparency and cost efficiency for investors. These reforms include reducing total expense ratios and brokerage fees, alongside simplifying IPO disclosures and revamping stock broker regulations. The board also deferred a decision on managing internal conflicts of interest.

title: India VIX hits new low as directionless market drains volatility
summary: India's Volatility Index (VIX) hit a fresh lifetime low of 9.84, reflecting expectations of reduced market swings. This decline is attributed to muted trading, a lack of significant market triggers, and reduced derivatives activity, with analysts noting a contraction in realized volatility and lower option premiums.

title: Stock Radar: SBI Life Insurance stock breaks out from downward sloping trendline; time to buy?
summary: SBI Life Insurance stock has achieved new record highs after breaking a downward trendline. Experts recommend buying the stock for short-term gains. The stock shows strong bullish momentum with positive moving average crossovers and above-average volumes. Traders can target Rs 2,115-2,240 with a stop-loss at Rs 1,940.

title: Insurance companies must switch to 1600-series numbers by Feb 15: Trai
summary: All entities regulated by the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India must use the designated numbering series for customer service and transaction-related calls, Trai said in a direction issued on Tuesday. The deadline was set in consultation with the insurance regulator.

title: CareEdge revises upward India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.5%
summary: CareEdge Ratings has raised India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.5% from 6.9%, citing stronger-than-expected first-half performance. Despite this upward revision, economic activity is expected to moderate in the latter half of the fiscal year. The rating firm also anticipates the rupee to trade between 89-90 against the dollar in FY27.

title: Stock recommendations for 18 December from MarketSmith India
summary: MarketSmith India reveals its top stock recommendations for today, 18 December. Get expert insights into the best-performing stocks to guide your investment decisions.

title: Stocks to buy: Raja Venkatraman's top picks for 18 December
summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his top three stock picks to buy today, 18 December. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

title: Speciale Invest to launch  ₹1,600 crore growth fund for deeptech investment
summary: While 60% of the fund will be for new investments, 40% is being allocated to follow-on rounds in new and old portfolio companies.

title: Adulteration fears may spur premium dairy boom in urban markets
summary: Tighter regulation, rising health awareness and fresh capital are helping organic dairy brands deepen farm control, strengthen traceability and test whether premium pricing can scale beyond niche urban consumers.

title: Space startups expect revenue build-up as investors turn bullish
summary: With $50 million in series-B funding, Digantara joined Skyroot as only two Indian space startups to have raised such capital in a single funding round. Marquee investors, including Peak XV, are now bullish on India's prospects of raising large capital as they start generating substantial revenue.

title: TCS pegs AI revenue at $1.5 billion, $11 billion from new-age services
summary: In a first for large homegrown IT services companies, Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (TCS) said on Wednesday that it earns $11 billion in revenue from disruptive technologies, including $1.5 billion from artificial intelligence (AI).

title: 6 GHz showdown: Jio questions Meta’s $3 trillion economic value math
summary: Meta anticipates a $3 trillion value from delicensing 500 MHz of the 6 GHz band spectrum, compared to $254 billion from the 700 MHz portion that the government plans to auction. Jio says the calculations are not comparable.

title: HCL Tech shares in focus on contract with Netherlands’ ASN Bank for digital transformation
summary: HCL Tech has been selected as a strategic partner by ASN Bank in the Netherlands to modernize its IT architecture under a multi-year agreement. This collaboration aims to consolidate IT services and enhance efficiency. The IT major's Q2 net profit remained flat year-on-year, while revenue from operations saw an 11% increase.

title: World-beating 55,000% surge in Indian AI stock fuels bubble fears
summary: India's RRP Semiconductor, once the world's best-performing stock with a 55,000% surge, is now a cautionary tale. Despite negative revenue and a tiny employee base, online hype fueled its rise. Regulators are now examining the surge, highlighting risks for retail investors chasing AI proxies.

title: Stocks to buy for 2026: RBL Bank, HDFC Life among 5 stocks that could give 10-30% return in 1 year
summary: We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources.

title: HDFC AMC among other AMC stocks in focus after Sebi's mutual fund expense ratio rule changes
summary: As per the revised framework, the total mutual fund expense ratio will now consist of four separate components: the base expense ratio, brokerage, statutory levies, and regulatory levies.

title: Ola Electric shares in focus after Bhavish Aggarwal offloads another 4.2 crore shares via open mkt transaction
summary: The company, after Tuesday's stake sale, stated that the stake sale was a one-time, limited monetisation of a small portion of the promoter’s personal stake. The proceeds from the transaction are intended to fully repay a promoter-level loan worth Rs 260 crore.

title: DCM Shriram Industries demerger: Last day to buy shares before Dec 19 record date. Here's what shareholders will receive
summary: Shareholders whose names appear on the company’s register as of the record date will be entitled to receive equity shares in the two newly formed companies under the approved composite scheme of arrangement.

title: Dr. Lal PathLabs shares turn ex-bonus tomorrow for 1:1 issue, last day to buy for eligibility
summary: As per the corporate filings, the company will issue one fully paid-up bonus equity share of face value Rs 10 for every one existing fully paid-up equity share of Rs 10 held by shareholders as on the record date.

title: Pajson Agro India shares to list today. Here's what GMP suggests
summary: The Rs 74.45 crore book-built IPO was subscribed 6.5 times overall, led by qualified institutional buyers, who subscribed their portion nearly 11 times.

title: HRS Aluglaze shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
summary: The Rs 51 crore book-built IPO was subscribed 44.83 times overall, driven by strong demand from non-institutional and retail investors

title: Negative Breakout: These 7 stocks cross below their 200 DMAs
summary: The 200 DMA is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock.

title: KSH International IPO Day 3 Live: Issue sees weak demand, GMP signals muted listing - Apply or not on last day?
summary: KSH International IPO Day 3 Live: The company aims to raise  ₹710 crore through the IPO and has set the IPO price band at  ₹365– ₹384 per share. The allotment is likely to be finalised tomorrow, December 19 and share will list on December 23.

title: KSH International IPO Day 3: Issue subscribed 26% so far. GMP, others details, apply or not?
summary: The GMP of KSH International IPO has fallen to +0 on Thursday, December 28, from +6, as per Investorgain. This means that the shares of the KSH International IPO is currently trading at a premium  ₹0.

title: Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, Asian markets to gold prices
summary: Indian stock market indices, Sensex and Nifty 50, are expected to open flat to slightly negative on December 17, following three sessions of losses and global market concerns. The Sensex closed down 120 points, while Nifty dropped 42 points amid ongoing investor caution.

summary: Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three intraday stocks to buy today — GNA Axles, Grasim Industries, ONGC

summary: IndiGo is set for an unwelcome arrival on the Sensex on 22 December, its debut overshadowed by severe operational turbulence.&nbsp;

summary: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today - GRM Overseas, India Cements, Mahindra and Mahindra Financial Services, Avanti Feeds, and MM Forgings.

title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on December 18
summary: The Sensex is facing resistance near 84,900, with potential to drop to 84,000–83,800 if 84,300 is broken. Nifty 50 remains range-bound, while Bank Nifty's future hinges on holding above 58,800, with significant resistance at 60,000–60,120.

title: Tata Steel shares up 25% in 2025 after a sharp run-up. Should you chase the rally or brace for a pause?
summary: Tata Steel shares have surged 25% in 2025, driven by expansion approvals like the Neelachal Ispat Nigam Ltd project and a strategic acquisition. While these moves promise long-term growth and margin improvement, mixed technical signals suggest a potential pause as the market weighs execution risk against future potential.

title: Sensex falls over 100 pts, Nifty below 25,800 amid trade pact worries
summary: Indian stocks extended losses for a fourth session on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty falling amid U.S.-India trade deal uncertainty. However, a rebound in the rupee and renewed foreign investor buying offered some support. Global markets also saw declines, particularly in technology shares, while oil prices advanced due to geopolitical tensions.

title: Meesho shares rally 8%, double from IPO price in just 7 sessions. What’s driving the surge?
summary: Meesho shares have surged to a new record high, gaining 110% since their IPO. The company's market capitalization now exceeds Rs 1 lakh crore. International brokerage UBS initiated coverage with a Buy rating, predicting strong growth in Net Merchandise Value. This rally follows a successful IPO that saw significant demand from investors.

title: Nifty’s worst performers of 2025: 10 stocks that took the biggest hit this year
summary: While the Nifty 50 saw gains in 2025, several prominent stocks experienced significant declines. Trent led the pack with a 43% drop, followed by IT giants like TCS and Infosys, which fell 22% and over 15% respectively. Earnings disappointments and sector headwinds impacted these heavyweights.

title: TCS shares rise as co eyes global AI leadership. Check target price
summary: TCS shares: The company laid out an ambitious plan to become the world’s largest AI-led technology services firm. At its Analyst Day, TCS detailed a shift from traditional digital services to AI-centric enterprise transformation, anchored around a five-pillar strategy covering internal AI adoption, AI-driven services, future-ready talent, real-world client use cases, and ecosystem expansion.

title: Sensex to cross 90,000 in 2026? What top brokerages predict in ET Markets poll
summary: Indian equities are poised for a blockbuster 2026, with a poll of 13 brokerages predicting the Sensex will surpass 90,000. This optimism stems from expected Fed rate cuts, accelerating earnings, and a potential reversal of foreign selloffs, with many anticipating foreign investor inflows.

title: KSH International IPO Day 3: Check GMP trend, subscription update and key details. Should you subscribe?
summary: The Rs 710-crore KSH International IPO entered its final day with muted investor response, as the grey market premium slipped back to zero. Subscription stood at 26% by Day 2, with retail interest relatively better, while NII participation remained weak and QIBs stayed on the sidelines.

title: Sammaan Capital among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
summary: Five stocks in the NSE F&O segment recorded a sharp rise in futures open interest as of December 17, indicating heightened derivatives activity. Polycab India, Colgate-Palmolive (India), Sammaan Capital, Muthoot Finance and KEI Industries saw notable OI additions, reflecting fresh positions, expanding participation and growing trader interest.

title: Titagarh Rail shares in focus on Rs 273-crore Indian Railways order
summary: Titagarh Rail Systems secured a significant Rs 273.24 crore rail maintenance project from the Ministry of Railways for 62 Rail Borne Maintenance Vehicles. This contract, covering the entire lifecycle of the specialized machines, marks the company's expansion into integrated rail safety solutions. Despite a recent Q2FY26 dip, the company maintains a robust order book.

title: Kaynes Technology and 6 other stocks close crossing below VWAP
summary: On December 17, seven Nifty500 stocks closed more than 1.5% below their VWAP levels, signalling potential bearish pressure. A close below VWAP indicates the stock ended the session beneath its volume-weighted average price, often reflecting rising selling interest and weakening intraday sentiment among market participants.

title: Vedanta demerger: Citi sees value as 5-way split approaches, debt stays in check
summary: Vedanta’s plan to split into five listed, pure-play companies is moving closer to execution after tribunal approval, with Citi arguing the demerger could unlock value by narrowing the conglomerate discount. While key approvals and asset transfers are still pending, the brokerage says parent-level debt remains manageable and sees upside from aluminium prices, cost efficiencies and volume growth as the breakup advances toward its March 2026 target.

title: Akzo Nobel shares in focus after Goldman Sachs buys Rs 106 crore worth stake in bulk deal
summary: Akzo Nobel India shares: Goldman Sachs bought shares worth ₹106 crore through a bulk deal, while promoter Imperial Chemical Industries sold a much larger stake worth ₹1,296 crore. The heavy promoter selling dragged the stock down over 11% in Wednesday’s session, despite Goldman’s purchase of about 3.36 lakh shares via its India equity portfolio.

title: APL Apollo Tubes among 5 midcap stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
summary: Five Nifty200 stocks showed improving momentum on 16 December as their RSI readings crossed above the 50 mark. This shift signals strengthening price action and early accumulation. Rising RSI levels often indicate a developing bullish bias, offering traders early insight into potential upside as sentiment and trend strength improve.

title: Meesho shares turn multibagger! Stock soars over 110% from IPO price to hit record high again - Should you still buy?
summary: Meesho's share price has surged 110% from its IPO price, hitting  ₹233.50 for the third consecutive session. UBS has initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating, projecting a target of  ₹220, indicating the stock's immediate optimism may be priced in.

title: HDFC AMC, ABSL to Canara Robeco: AMC stocks rise as SEBI cuts mutual funds fee
summary: SEBI board decided on Wednesday to cut the charges of the expense ratios in mutual funds, revising its long-standing norms in an effort to boost retail investors' participation and improve compliance.

title: Gold rates drop on MCX on profit booking ahead of US inflation data; experts highlight key levels to watch
summary: Gold price today: MCX gold February contracts were 0.20% down at  ₹1,34,619 per 10 grams around 9:20 am. MCX silver March contracts were 0.47% down at  ₹2,06,451 per kg at that time.

title: Sebi reduces the expense ratio of mutual fund AMCs. What does it mean for the Indian stock market? Explained
summary: Sebi has reduced the expense ratio for mutual funds, aiming to lower costs and enhance transparency for investors. While this is a positive development for retail investors, concerns about foreign institutional investor outflows remain a significant challenge for the market.

title: Global uncertainty could create a 3–5% downside, warns Sushant Bhansali; sees small-cap stocks reviving in 2026
summary: Sushant Bhansali of Ambit Asset Management indicates cautious optimism in India's equity markets, predicting mid-teen returns for the Nifty amid global uncertainty. He advises investors to avoid speculation ahead of the Budget, highlighting potential tax changes as a risk.

title: Stock market today: Trade set up for Nifty 50 to Indian Rupee; 8 stocks to buy or sell on Thursday — 18 December 2025
summary: Stock market today: Experts have recommended eight stocks to buy today — Shriram Finance, Canara Bank, IndusInd Bank, PNB, Tech Mahindra, BoB, Suprajit Engineering, Jyothy Labs

title: Mystery ‘American media company’ wanted to buy Warner Bros Discovery at $25 billion in cash, new filing shows
summary: In a Securities and Exchange Commission filing, Warner Bros Discovery said it received offers for all or some of its business from Netflix and Paramount on November 20. Apart from this, an undisclosed Company A and Company C also made offers to acquire it.

title: A $600-million Byju's deal unwound: Great Learning finds its way back to founders
summary: Great Learning co-founder Mohan Lakhamraju has reacquired an Indian unit of his former business from Byju’s parent at a fraction of the $600 million that it was bought for. He is negotiating with Byju's lenders over control of Great Learning's Singapore operations valued at $150-200 million.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Goldman Sachs maintains buy on L&T; Motilal Oswal initiates coverage on Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals
summary: Brokerages remain bullish on select large- and mid-cap stocks, citing strong earnings visibility and long-term growth drivers. Goldman Sachs reiterated a Buy on L&T, Nuvama maintained a positive view on TCS amid AI-led recovery hopes, while Motilal Oswal initiated coverage on Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals with a Buy, pointing to a sharp earnings rebound and margin expansion potential.

title: KPI Green shares gain 4% on landmark deal with Botswana for renewable energy projects
summary: KPI Green Energy shares surged following its parent company's MoU with Botswana for renewable energy development. The agreement aims to establish large-scale generation, storage, and transmission infrastructure, requiring an estimated $4 billion investment. This collaboration supports Botswana's net-zero goals and KP Group's international expansion.

title: HRS Aluglaze IPO listing: SME stock hits upper circuit after listing at a 31% premium
summary: HRS Aluglaze IPO listing: The SME stock was listed at  ₹126, up 31.25% over the issue price of  ₹96. Soon after the strong debut, the stock extended gains to hit its 5% upper circuit of  ₹132.30.

title: Indian share market opens lower amid global sell-off, but Nifty IT surge 1 % despite US tech selling
summary: Domestic stock markets opened on a cautious note on Thursday, tracking sharp overnight losses in the US markets, as investors booked profits in high-valuation technology and artificial intelligence (AI) stocks.

title: Ola Electric share price slumps 4% to fresh low as promoter Bhavish Aggarwal sells stake, down 59% from IPO price
summary: Ola Electric Mobility share price fell continues to decline, fell nearly 4.29% to  ₹31.49 apiece on NSE in Thursday's trading session.

title: Pajson Agro India shares off to a decent start despite stock market fall, list at 5% premium on BSE SME
summary: Pajson Agro India IPO shares listed at a premium of 5.08%. The company plans to use IPO funds for a new facility in Vizianagaram, Andhra Pradesh, and other corporate purposes.
